snippet: Elite forces are trying to hold their ground near Lashkar Gah, the capital of Helmand Province and a critical link in the defense of the region....
abstract: Afghan special forces scramble to defend key cities in Helmand Province from resurgent Taliban; control of country's largest province provides access to its opium trade, significant source of funding for Taliban and lure to corruption for Afghan soldiers and officials.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, and Mohammad Fahim Abed from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Elite forces are trying to hold their ground near Lashkar Gah, the capital of Helmand Province and a critical link in the defense of the region.

headline.main: Afghanistan Forces Struggle to Hold Firm Against Taliban in South
headline.print_headline: Afghan Forces Struggle to Stand Firm Against Taliban in Helmand Province
